Total_Summary_Homelessness.Total_Homelessness_Annotation: Although damage in relation to the cyclone was limited, the name Magda was retired following its usage and was later replaced with Megan.

Specific_Instance_Per_Country_Homelessne.Homelessness_with_annotation: A few homes around Kuri Bay sustained roof damage, but no injuries were reported.

Main_Event_Assessment_With_Annotation: Severe Tropical Cyclone Magda was a relatively small tropical cyclone that brought minor damage to parts of Western Australia in January 2010.

Total_Summary_Insured_Damage.Total_Insured_Damage_Assessment_with_ann: Although the storm made landfall with winds of 130 km/h (81 mph), damage was limited due to the sparsely populated region it struck. The most severe damage was defoliation around Kuri Bay.

Total_Insured_Damage_Per_Country.Total_Insured_Damage_Assessment_with_ann: Although the storm made landfall with winds of 130 km/h (81 mph), damage was limited due to the sparsely populated region it struck. The most severe damage was defoliation around Kuri Bay.

Specific_Instance_Per_Country_Insured_Da.Insured_Damage_Assessment_with_annotatio: Although the storm made landfall with winds of 130 km/h (81 mph), damage was limited due to the sparsely populated region it struck. The most severe damage was defoliation around Kuri Bay.

Total_Summary_Displacement.Total_Displacement_Annotation: A mining company, working in Mount Gibson on Koolan Island, evacuated 228 employees due to the threat of the cyclone.

Total_Displacement_Per_Country.Displacement_with_annotation: A mining company, working in Mount Gibson on Koolan Island, evacuated 228 employees due to the threat of the cyclone.

Specific_Instance_Per_Country_Displaceme.Displacement_with_annotation: A mining company, working in Mount Gibson on Koolan Island, evacuated 228 employees due to the threat of the cyclone.

Location_with_Annotation.Western Australia: Severe Tropical Cyclone Magda was a relatively small tropical cyclone that brought minor damage to parts of Western Australia in January 2010.
Location_with_Annotation.Kimberley region: Late on 21 January, Magda made landfall in the Kimberley region with winds of 130 km/h (81 mph) before quickly weakening over land.
Location_with_Annotation.Kuri Bay: The most severe damage was defoliation around Kuri Bay.
Location_with_Annotation.Port Hedland: The remnants of Magda persisted until 24 January, at which time they dissipated east of Port Hedland.
Location_with_Annotation.Augustus Island: Within hours of reattaining severe tropical cyclone status, Magda passed over Augustus Island.
Location_with_Annotation.Buccaneer Archipelago: Early on 22 January, the storm briefly moved back over water, having weakened slightly, before making another landfall east of the Buccaneer Archipelago with winds of 110 km/h (68 mph).
Location_with_Annotation.Derby: Later that day, Magda passed directly over the town of Derby, where winds were measured under gale-force.
Location_with_Annotation.Mount Gibson: A mining company, working in Mount Gibson on Koolan Island, evacuated 228 employees due to the threat of the cyclone.
Location_with_Annotation.Koolan Island: A mining company, working in Mount Gibson on Koolan Island, evacuated 228 employees due to the threat of the cyclone.

Total_Economic_Damage_Per_Country.Total_Economic_Damage_Assessment_with_an: Although the storm made landfall with winds of 130 km/h (81 mph), damage was limited due to the sparsely populated region it struck. The most severe damage was defoliation around Kuri Bay.

Specific_Instance_Per_Country_Economic_D.Economic_Damage_Assessment_with_annotati: The most severe damage was defoliation around Kuri Bay. A few homes around Kuri Bay sustained roof damage, but no injuries were reported.

Perils_Assessment_With_Annotation: Wind: 'Although the storm made landfall with winds of 130 km/h (81 mph)' | 'wind gusts were estimated up to 185 km/h (115 mph)' | 'gale-force winds extended roughly 85 km (53 mi) from the centre of Magda' | Rainfall: 'Heavy rains in excess of 100 mm (3.9 in) were expected to fall along the storm's track.' | 'Rainfall peaked at 185 mm (7.3 in) in Kuri Bay over a three-day span.'
